commit_message:
Add irrelevant files list to perfload job

We don't want perfload to run on docs, tox, or test changes, but
because it is based off a very basic job (to avoid weight) there was
no built in irrlevant-files list. This adds one to ensure that the
job only runs on code-related changes.

We need a slightly different list of files from the list used by
integrated gate jobs so do not use the changes made in
Iae26251cb455640fbc74dad326666d2015e7a46c .

Change-Id: I092b5ed19ef51c42a714984127e2fdc91d5c6c70

commit_message:
change nova.services.disable use service_uuid

nova_api_version has been bump to 2.53 in bug/1800073,
with this version, nova-client only take service_uuid to disable service,
args host_name and binary are no longer supported.

Change-Id: I6ab942f657f8983a22c9e16747090399c01fc3f8
Closes-bug: 1811742

[{'created': '2019-01-20 22:10:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incorrect process on init_container

When zun-compute is restarted, it calls init_container to
continue previous tasks. However, not all tasks can be resume
properly. If container's tasks are unrecoverable (i.e.
NETWORK_ATTACHING, NETWORK_DETACHING, SG_ADDING and SG_REMOVING),
set the container to "Error" state instead.

Change-Id: If7711ef9c6e3f1b90635a2e5bdd28bc702ed3b66
Closes-Bug: #1812590
'}, {'created': '2019-01-21 03:51:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incorrect process on init_container

When zun-compute is restarted, it calls init_container to
continue previous tasks. However, not all tasks can be resume
properly. If container's tasks are unrecoverable (i.e.
NETWORK_ATTACHING, NETWORK_DETACHING, SG_ADDING and SG_REMOVING),
set the container to "Error" state instead.

commit_message:
Fix incorrect process on init_container

When zun-compute is restarted, it calls init_container to
continue previous tasks. However, not all tasks can be resume
properly. If container's tasks are unrecoverable (i.e.
NETWORK_ATTACHING, NETWORK_DETACHING, SG_ADDING and SG_REMOVING),
set the container to "Error" state instead.

Change-Id: If7711ef9c6e3f1b90635a2e5bdd28bc702ed3b66
Closes-Bug: #1812590

The 'command' parameter has changed from string to list [1].
This patch updates the UI to catch this up.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580990/

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I2e9dad53d2d0b6cde14cf698e92a3f302dc0996b
Closes-Bug:  #1801693

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-30 07:44:17.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4261f530bbc4a5d927fc88b69261458a85e9b59f
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4261f530bbc4a5d927fc88b69261458a85e9b59f

commit_message:
Service check in nova_cell_v2_discover_host.py to use internal API

e0e885b8ca3332e0815c537a32c564cac81f7f7e moved the cellv2 discovery from
control plane to compute services. In case the computes won't have access
to the external API the service check will fail. This switch the service
check to use the internal endpoint.

Change-Id: I234db0866fb6f1adefdcf7a2b2a82412e443b7c9
Closes-bug: 1812632

commit_message:
mistral-executor: bind-mount /var/lib/containers

We are replacing Docker by Podman and our Container Image workflow
running in mistral_executor container now needs access to
/var/lib/containers directory for the podman pull commands, otherwise
podman complains with:

  'overlay' is not supported over overlayfs: backing file system is
  unsupported for this graph driver

It also switches the container to be run in privileged mode, since it
needs to run podman commands.

blueprint podman-support
Change-Id: I158ded93512c0e232071a9dacd8f7770d911f169

commit_message:
Make scenario gates use devstack-tempest parent

This patch modernizes the legacy tempest gates (excluding multinode) to
run using parent devstack-tempest jobs.
The multi-node jobs will be done in a later patch as they require more
work.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/562356
Change-Id: Ie9936496266ce29a183f734cce4f72efeab91caf

commit_message:
Updating requirements for pyudev

The stable/queens branch has a lower constraint for pyudev
version (0.16.1). This is required for backporting
NIC Partitioning feature to stable/queens.

Change-Id: I81c93a6f44b5b587759c002ad29b5c087ec53205

commit_message:
Adding pyshim.sh to missing python commands

All docker-config-scripts python scripts requires to be called
using pyshim.sh in order to work properly. Otherwise it fails
because the python files are not executable.

Change-Id: I0a8148aa1fdffa72b052a9a8eeb434721aba5010
Closes-Bug: #1812641

commit_message:
do not always plug ovs ports.

As part of resolving bug #1734320 the os-vif ovs plugin
was modified to always plug the vif to ovs in all code paths.
This change reverts that behavior as it has been determined
that libvirt will recreate the port which introduces new
issues for neutron and breaks the intent of the os-vif change.

Change-Id: I76a2de2e8077d8a931af0056690dad4a569e228a
Related-Bug: #1728600
Related-Bug: #1808171
Related-Bug: #1811405

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-21 15:27:09.000000000', 'message': 'Grafana: Update Ceph dashboards for Mimic release

This updates the Ceph dashboards for Grafana, as some of the ceph
metrics have changed with the Mimic release.  This fixes issues
with the ceph OSD metrics that broke some Grafana panels, and also
removes the Ceph panel for displaying the number of monitors in
quorum, as that metric has been removed in Mimic

Change-Id: If6cbbfa7d2972ddd0e44b29a6c8277188d2d9ff0
'}]
commit_message:
Grafana: Update Ceph dashboards for Mimic release

This updates the Ceph dashboards for Grafana, as some of the ceph
metrics have changed with the Mimic release.  This fixes issues
with the ceph OSD metrics that broke some Grafana panels, and also
removes the Ceph panel for displaying the number of monitors in
quorum, as that metric has been removed in Mimic

Change-Id: If6cbbfa7d2972ddd0e44b29a6c8277188d2d9ff0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-11 17:31:13.000000000', 'message': 'VMAX Driver - VMAX OS Upgrade Bug

Workload support was dropped in ucode 5978. If a VMAX All Flash
array is upgraded to 5978 or greater and existing volume types
leveraged workload e.g. DSS, DSS_REP, OLTP and OLTP_REP,
attaching and detaching will no longer work and the volume type
will be unusable.

Change-Id: I0ad0c530c93a9494e1a3048e557360b38c4a125b
Closes-Bug: #1790141
(cherry picked from commit 546faf0cd5fa86dadec3a04765e5592f1a1305ab)
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX Driver - VMAX OS Upgrade Bug

Workload support was dropped in ucode 5978. If a VMAX All Flash
array is upgraded to 5978 or greater and existing volume types
leveraged workload e.g. DSS, DSS_REP, OLTP and OLTP_REP,
attaching and detaching will no longer work and the volume type
will be unusable.

Change-Id: I0ad0c530c93a9494e1a3048e557360b38c4a125b
Closes-Bug: #1790141
(cherry picked from commit 546faf0cd5fa86dadec3a04765e5592f1a1305ab)

commit_message:
Move network segment range types to lib constants

Move NETWORK_SEGMENT_RANGE_TYPE_LIST from api-def to
neutron_lib.constants and renamed to NETWORK_SEGMENT_RANGE_TYPES so
that the constant can be used elsewhere.

Co-authored-by: Allain Legacy <Allain.legacy@windriver.com>

Partially-implements: blueprint network-segment-range-management
Change-Id: I6d49faf9eef9087d6ae5c3722f0b9a2a3f980c63

commit_message:
WIP: Fedora support for python3 package testing

RDO is currently using a version of Fedora 28 to test the python3
packaging for the next version of CentOS/RHEL.  This change updates adds
basic support to support Fedora28 as a build option.

Change-Id: I4d6d5f477a6308d7000a22de669afbc05526fb43

commit_message:
Update skydive to use TLS

This change implements TLS configurations for skydive. All servers will
get their own certificates signed by the CA as setup on the
`skydive_service_setup_host` node.

> Documentation for TLS configuration can be found here: http://skydive.network/documentation/

Change-Id: I890b4a5d9076b0474ffe5649f9361cb6018c19fe
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Allow skydive keystone service setup from an alternate host

This patch allows a deployer to override the service setup host
and python interpreter path so that the keystone service setup
can be done on a different host, typically the first utility
container in an openstack-ansible deployment.

Overrides can be provided in an integration inventory and an
example would be:

skydive_service_setup_host: "{{ groups['utility_all'][0] }}"
skydive_service_setup_host_python_interpreter: "/openstack/venvs/utility-{{ openstack_release }}/bin/python"

Change-Id: Id4faf605fd1f0de1262ed48166a8801b7e24a528

commit_message:
Remove stickiness config from traefik backends

This config line prevents the downloaded binary version
of traefik from starting up, which in turn prevents the skydive
binary from starting up correctly.

Change-Id: Ic07a3c6170ff4e0ad60dbdb860eff0f330b677a1

commit_message:
Run puppetforge publish playbook in the clouds

Changes the hosts field from localhost to all
so that the publish playbook is executed in
the cloud instead of locally on the zuul executor
node.

This is required because when it's executed on the
zuul executor the security context supresses the
facts as a security measure which causes the job to fail.

Change-Id: Iab2252ca647bd6d8eaff6c48f458c566c0393cb2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-16 18:55:02.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the shebang from a script

The script is not used during the normal execution of the plugin,
but it is useful to extract the CDH configuration when, for example,
bootstrapping a plugin.
The other copies of the plugin for older versions of CDH does not
have the shebang line.

Moreover, the removal helps with packaging under Fedora:
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Changes/Make_ambiguous_python_shebangs_error

Change-Id: I877473373a23b1dc988b5b05e35493d4b6d7cab3
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the shebang from a script

The script is not used during the normal execution of the plugin,
but it is useful to extract the CDH configuration when, for example,
bootstrapping a plugin.
The other copies of the plugin for older versions of CDH does not
have the shebang line.

Moreover, the removal helps with packaging under Fedora:
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Changes/Make_ambiguous_python_shebangs_error

Change-Id: I877473373a23b1dc988b5b05e35493d4b6d7cab3

subject: Remove the shebang from a script
messages:

commit_message:
Remove the shebang from a script

The script is not used during the normal execution of the plugin,
but it is useful to extract the Ambari configuration when,
for example, bootstrapping it.

Moreover, the removal helps with packaging under Fedora:
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Changes/Make_ambiguous_python_shebangs_error

Change-Id: Ibf71bc9ca298e28821dd5ef51159799fb3645842

(2 comments)

Some minor comments.

Also, i would like to understand better how we are suddenly gaining support on ubuntu 16 and centos... spark on SIE could not do that. I'd love to poke into it next week... (after FF... I think this could still merge before I explore it, but if not this is a sane FFE candidate)"}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-25 08:56:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Some minor comments.
 > 
 > Also, i would like to understand better how we are suddenly gaining
 > support on ubuntu 16 and centos... spark on SIE could not do that.
 > I'd love to poke into it next week... (after FF... I think this
 > could still merge before I explore it, but if not this is a sane
 > FFE candidate)

On the Ubuntu side, because it previously required a version of CDH Spark which did not support Ubuntu 16.04. CDH 5.11 supports it, and so every version of Spark that uses it.
About CentOS, probably simply no one created the support for it but Telles may remember the story better."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-25 08:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Also, about trusty support, see https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/sahara-rocky-ptg, line 262 ("Move out of trusty now")'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-07-25 11:42:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> > (2 comments)

 > > Also, i would like to understand better how we are suddenly

 > that.
 > > I'd love to poke into it next week... (after FF... I think this
 > > could still merge before I explore it, but if not this is a sane
 > > FFE candidate)

 > On the Ubuntu side, because it previously required a version of CDH
 > Spark which did not support Ubuntu 16.04. CDH 5.11 supports it, and
 > so every version of Spark that uses it.
 > About CentOS, probably simply no one created the support for it but
 > Telles may remember the story better.

Centos was just not done before. We should have, but never did. The story is as simple as that"}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-07-25 11:47:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

ok, sounds good, I forgot we already had Ubuntu 16. and the centos stuff is sane.'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-09-11 16:15:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Adding Spark to sahara-image-pack

Adding the ability to create spark images using the new image
generation.

commit_message:
Use buildah commands for yum update to improve speed

This allows directly mounting directories instead of copying them
twice. Also the resulting image has only one extra layer instead of
one per Dockerfile directive.

Change-Id: I8a3769c0b55572ba05cc29ecd28a131cc94e8c4d

commit_message:
Enable image inject metadata properties & user roles to be ignored

Adding GlanceInjectMetadataProperties & GlanceIgnoreUserRoles to
inject metadata properties to the image with specific user roles
to be ignored for injecting metadata properties in the image.

Conflicts:
    puppet/services/glance-api.yaml

Change-Id: Ie6504f73fd5f7492389d6c55a89c66b8ca568ef7
(cherry picked from commit ae8998f36a92484a13b5f23f63102494634ae58b)

commit_message:
Add provider UUID to reshaper gen conflict error

To aid debuggability, the provider UUID was added to the error message
for the generation conflict exception in nova's incarnation of the
reshaper handler via [1]. This patch syncs the change to the placement
repository.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/615695/

Change-Id: I606e883983da65a2253be23ee1786d10ee53680c

Gibi's comments indicate that I need to be far more explicit about microversions in these documents. You can't get 'code' below 1.23. I'll try to make that more clear.

Also, the error on a 401 is produced by keystonemiddleware, outside of placement's control. I'm not sure that's worth describing in these docs?"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-13 14:19:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-12-13 17:25:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

> Gibi's comments indicate that I need to be far more explicit about
 > microversions in these documents. You can't get 'code' below 1.23.
 > I'll try to make that more clear.

Adding a microversion helped a lot :) Now I see the ``code`` in the response.

 > 
 > Also, the error on a 401 is produced by keystonemiddleware, outside
 > of placement's control. I'm not sure that's worth describing in
 > these docs?

I would mention this in the doc as the developer of a client might not know that she has to take care two different format."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-13 19:07:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm going to be out tomorrow, so if someone else (gibi?) would like to get the suggested fixes (which make sense) that's fine with me, otherwise I'll get it next week."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-17 13:14:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

I is hard to explain it without mentioning a specific example (i.e. consumer and RP). But I think it is better now.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2019-01-04 03:01:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Document API error codes

Add a section to the api-ref describing the error codes that some
responses produce.

Note in the contributor docs that this should be updated when one is
added.

The reshaper docs is adjusted so a ref can be made to it from the
errors. The implicit link to the header that would be the norm there
doesn't work as there are two headers named "Reshaper".

Change-Id: I89bbd383ba102fdd707ccc9f2fc973c6dd841fa8
Closes-Bug: #1794712

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-17 22:37:29.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add upgrade status check for incomplete consumers

Since the create_incomplete_consumers online data migration
was copied from nova to placement, and will eventually be
removed from nova (and the nova online data migration won't
help once the placement data is copied over to extracted placement
on upgrade anyway), this adds an upgrade check to make sure
operators completed that online data migration.

Normally we wouldn't add upgrade checks for online data migrations
which should get automatically run by deployment tools, but since
extracted placement is very new, it's nice to provide tooling to
let operators know they have not only properly migrated their
data to extracted placement but whether or not their upgrade
homework is done.

Change-Id: I7f3ba20153a4c1dc8f5b209024edb882fcb726ef

commit_message:
Add upgrade status check for incomplete consumers

Since the create_incomplete_consumers online data migration
was copied from nova to placement, and will eventually be
removed from nova (and the nova online data migration won't
help once the placement data is copied over to extracted placement
on upgrade anyway), this adds an upgrade check to make sure
operators completed that online data migration.

Normally we wouldn't add upgrade checks for online data migrations
which should get automatically run by deployment tools, but since
extracted placement is very new, it's nice to provide tooling to
let operators know they have not only properly migrated their
data to extracted placement but whether or not their upgrade
homework is done.

Change-Id: I7f3ba20153a4c1dc8f5b209024edb882fcb726ef

commit_message:
Check network connectivity of the instance before and after live
migration

Finish the TODO in api/compute/admin/test_live_migration.py
   TODO(mriedem): SSH validation before and after the instance is
   live migrated would be a nice test wrinkle addition.

Change-Id: Id6e93983300d061d238613fc5937c06e15b19809

If neutron version is not restricted to stable/rocky then pip would
install latest master, which causes conflicts in test runs.

Change-Id: Ic71f6cc400f67fcf4ed71fcb2e635143ac5dd46d
'}]
commit_message:
Upper-constraint neutron to stable/rocky

If neutron version is not restricted to stable/rocky then pip would
install latest master, which causes conflicts in test runs.

Change-Id: Ic71f6cc400f67fcf4ed71fcb2e635143ac5dd46d

I think there are two things we need to decide: 1. how/where priorities are set; 2. if/when do we allow overrides of the same deploy step.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2018-01-03 17:46:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2018-01-03 17:46:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2018-03-19 17:00:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Patch Set 12 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2018-03-19 17:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Workflow-1

The dependency here is more inspirational than anything, need some rework post PTG.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-05 15:09:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14: Patch Set 13 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-05 15:18:42.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1722275 to story/1722275'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-05 16:28:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-05 16:30:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Made some updates to modernise it. Will return to this tomorrow.

Open question: should it be possible to trigger multiple deploy steps via a single trait?'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-09-05 16:33:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

> Open question: should it be possible to trigger multiple deploy steps via a single trait?

At least for RAID we may want to delete configuration, then create it.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-06 10:59:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

> > Open question: should it be possible to trigger multiple deploy
 > steps via a single trait?
 > 
 > At least for RAID we may want to delete configuration, then create
 > it.

That example (it's used in the spec) seems to be possible using a single step, but I can imagine use cases where a single feature that we might want to enable via a single trait may require multiple steps, perhaps because they need to run with different priorities.

More generally, I think we're looking for logic analogous to inspector rules:

"If these conditions match, apply these actions."

In this case, currently our condition is 'specified trait was requested', and the action is 'perform this deploy step'. I can definitely see a need for actions including multiple steps.

Perhaps we may also want to consider other conditions, such as 'these two traits were requested', or 'trait X and not trait Y', or 'trait X and node has hardware type H'. Perhaps that is going too far, but I wanted to put it out there for consideration.'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-09-11 18:13:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

(1 comment)

This looks good so far. 

wrt one trait -> more than one deploy step, there may be cases where that is desired. We can either plan for that now, or try to make sure that we can upgrade to that. e.g, for the deploy templates specification, support 1. both 'step' and 'steps' or 2. just 'steps', or 3. 'step' now and deprecate/use 'steps' later. I'm inclined to go with #2 (but restrict to 1 step for now); a hassle for one step only but how often are these deploy steps defined :)

wrt a deploy template having conditions like 'and node has this value', we can add that to the proposed template. Not sure right now, about doing any rules based on more than one trait -- i guess we could enhance the API to support those. I think it is worth updating the spec to mention these but that they are outside the scope of this spec."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-11 21:14:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > This looks good so far.
 > 
 > wrt one trait -> more than one deploy step, there may be cases
 > where that is desired. We can either plan for that now, or try to
 > make sure that we can upgrade to that. e.g, for the deploy
 > templates specification, support 1. both 'step' and 'steps' or 2.
 > just 'steps', or 3. 'step' now and deprecate/use 'steps' later. I'm
 > inclined to go with #2 (but restrict to 1 step for now); a hassle
 > for one step only but how often are these deploy steps defined :)
 > 

I think if we agree multiple steps will be useful, we should design it in from the beginning. It work be more work to add restrictions or change the schema down the road than to just implement it IMO.

 > wrt a deploy template having conditions like 'and node has this
 > value', we can add that to the proposed template. Not sure right
 > now, about doing any rules based on more than one trait -- i guess
 > we could enhance the API to support those. I think it is worth
 > updating the spec to mention these but that they are outside the
 > scope of this spec.

+1 for documenting this as interesting but out of scope in the spec."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-09-12 16:38:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Added note from PTG discussion on spec.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-26 18:34:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-09-27 20:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-09-27 22:57:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2

(9 comments)

LGTM. I find the beginning a little confusing as it is context setting heavy.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-28 09:25:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-28 09:56:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

Thanks for the review Jay. I'm getting the impression that you don't like this use of placement and traits to influence configuration.

Much like how we currently use capabilities, this spec aims to solve these two requirements:

* During 'nova boot', request some custom configuration to be applied to my bare metal server during provisioning.
* Ensure that my instance is scheduled to a bare metal node that supports the requested configuration.

As with capabilities, we're using a single field to encode configuration and scheduling information.

Would you prefer a design in which these two things were separate? In that case, this spec would not need to mention traits at all. Deploy templates could be requested by (non-trait) name or UUID as a flavor extra spec, pushed to a 'deploy_templates' field in ironic instance_info by the virt driver, then acted upon by ironic. If scheduling influence is required, this could be provided by traits, but this would be a separate concern.

I see some benefits to that approach. It would automatically support cases beyond the simple 1 trait -> 1 deploy template we have here, e.g. to support this deploy template, these two features must be supported by the node (without combinatorial trait explosions). In isolation, the configuration mechanism is conceptually simpler - the flavor specifies a deploy template directly. It would work in standalone ironic installs without introducing concepts from placement. Finally, we don't overload traits.

OTOH, using traits for both configuration and scheduling does have a nice simplicity to it, and familiarity for users of capabilities. Having flavors that specify resources, traits and deploy_templates in extra_specs could leave operators and users scratching their heads.

I think at the least I'll add a write up of that to the alternatives, and we can discuss from there."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-28 11:34:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-28 12:03:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-10-19 18:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-11-20 16:51:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1

(11 comments)

I'm fine with the proposal, just a few minor things inline."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-12-07 16:47:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

commit_message:
Deploy Templates

This builds on the deployment steps framework spec
(I2f68170e6741b0dbb6d5fbd5315a3be9fd7b28a7) such that it is possible to
request a particular set of deployment steps by requesting a set of
traits.

Change-Id: I7a56db52873655b15efe83282df8f864d932ca79
Story: 1722275
Task: 10626

commit_message:
Do not build projects with '-distgit' in project name

This is required to gate distgit projects with tripleo
jobs[1]. DLRN already builds packages for rpm spec changes,
no need to additionally build using dlrn-build.yml tasks.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/18151

Change-Id: Ib86a2e0e6200b00390443fe253abd0c3c0ef775f

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2019-01-15 18:17:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

For the record I don't like the solution.
When it's time to run the job in a configuration, you'll need to set something like

job:
  name: job
  vars:
    featureset_override:
      dlrn_hash_tag: something

dlrn_hash_tag has never been in a featureset and this definition doesn't make sense.
It's convenient because we are putting a variable where we know it can't be overriden anymore
but it's a dangerous trend, the list of overrides is growing and will continue, until it's not clear anymore where we need to put a variable, we just need it to override any other variable. In a while we'll need the override of the override.
We are messing with the variable passing, and we don't have a clear vision of where we're heading."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-01-15 20:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2019-01-17 21:37:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2019-01-21 13:46:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

One less for the repro'}]

commit_message:
Allow dlrn_hash_tag* vars to be overridden

When running the run-v3 playbook with the reproducer
workflow, a specific dlrn_hash_tag and newest tag
need to be passed to the job. This can be done in
featureset_override - if allowed in the playbook.

Also allows for getting a ready releases.sh file to use
to ensure a static dlrn hash.

Change-Id: I6201cd62e7d314fb8b53a104563c11c28ed8f2a2

commit_message:
Ensure logs folder is created in prep hosts tasks.

We have non fatal errors in the upgrade
jobs execution if the logs folder is not
created when adding the readme.txt file
to clarify the possible locations of
the logs.

Closes-Bug: 1811708
Change-Id: Ibc0a266bdc6630eaf34bfadeff21f7bd72fa75ad
(cherry picked from commit 1e318b569e522da0e200e53a92469baf97d3c9ab)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios@redhat.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10022, 'name': 'Gabriele Cerami', 'email': 'gcerami@redhat.com', 'username': 'panda'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27898, 'name': 'Quique Llorente', 'email': 'ellorent@redhat.com', 'username': 'quiquell'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-01-20 07:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-01-20 10:14:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-01-20 14:21:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-01-20 19:37:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-01-21 03:04:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-01-21 07:09:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2019-01-21 09:45:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The commit message is pretty concice, so I'm assuming this this is done so we can check and gate changes in ovb repos mapping stable/1.0 branch changes to master branch in other projects.
Is thre a zuulv3 way to do this ?
Is this enough to make zuul checkout master branch in other project ? Isn't this done by default when the branch doesn't exist in other project ?
Or this is done exclusively for build-test-packages role ?"}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-01-21 10:50:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Gabriele, the problem is that OVb has feature branches, not release branched. AFAIK zuul doesn't have tools to deal with it right now, there is ZUUL_BRANCH for the whole job. And problem is not with build-test role only, it sets release variable as 1.0 for whole job and you can see it fails when trying to find release file Centos-7/1.0.yaml

I don't think there is any chance we want to test OS release related job (like rocky) with OVB because OVB releases are not related to Openstack releases at all, that's why I map it to master explicitly."}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2019-01-21 11:04:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

I see this problematic with future OVB releases but let's just think about it them."}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2019-01-21 11:09:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks for the explanation, noting this issue in the zuulv3 migration epic, as even zuul.branch is affected and that one is not that easy to change.'}]

Probably cause on fedora we are mixing ansibles. Not sure we really want this. We shouldnt be using the python2 ansible for anything'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2019-01-21 09:00:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2019-01-21 10:30:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think this is tainting our tests. We were trying to do everything using only python3 packages. Installing a python2 package we may end up using it, and if in our customer installation they will not be available, we are testing an unrealistinc scenario.
Is there an actual bug in ansible for this ? is this used just for detection or are we using the python3 package ?'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2019-01-21 10:38:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

We need to use ansible over python3'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2019-01-21 10:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Well going to try it before -1'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2019-01-21 10:48:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

I had a discussion with Sorin, seems tehre is no aother way right now, but I'd like to see this clearly explained in the code, in a subsequent patch, so people will stop to ask "are we testing this wrong ?"'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2019-01-21 10:50:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

This can also be accomplished detecting ansible remote OS type if it's py3 env then use ansible_python_interpreted=/usr/bin/python3 but this is too much for something like qs.sh that is going to be deprecrated, let's just merge the fix."}]

commit_message:
install both python-libselinux versions on py3 env

Ansible is not detecting that python-libselinux
is installed when only the python3-libselinux
package is installed. Neat.

Closes-Bug: #1812324
Change-Id: I2492329880bf8c6e5cf4efc97900792b956bac4e

commit_message:
Allow Octavia deployments for Standalone

We have yet Nova for SSH keys management, when deploying a standalone
cloud. Allow Octavia deployments for such a case as well.
Jinja2 rendering of the octavia service template provides that
functionality by relying on a new role tag 'standalone'.

Change-Id: I69f3623646ec5b65109e0a4f0c16139018da9282
Closes-bug: #1806113
Co-Authored-By: Harald Jensas <hjensas@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-01-18 12:11:06.000000000', 'message': "firewall: allow ssh from any network by default

I89cff59947dda3f51482486c41a3d67c4aa36a3e broke SSH access on the
Undercloud, we shouldn't be that restrictive by default.

We weren't that restrictive when we add the rule in pre.pp:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582437/7/manifests/firewall/pre.pp

So let's restore the same rule.
Operators can override the rule if needed with Hiera.

"}, {'created': '2019-01-18 16:38:13.000000000', 'message': "Allow ssh from all for undercloud

I89cff59947dda3f51482486c41a3d67c4aa36a3e broke SSH access on the
Undercloud, we shouldn't be that restrictive by default for the
undercloud and standalone (as deployed via tripleo deploy).

This change adds a new parameter called SshFirewallAllowAll that can be
used to include an allow all for ssh. By default it is disabled when
deploying the overcloud but is used by the undercloud and standalone to
allow access after installation.

commit_message:
Allow ssh from all for undercloud

I89cff59947dda3f51482486c41a3d67c4aa36a3e broke SSH access on the
Undercloud, we shouldn't be that restrictive by default for the
undercloud and standalone (as deployed via tripleo deploy).

This change adds a new parameter called SshFirewallAllowAll that can be
used to include an allow all for ssh. By default it is disabled when
deploying the overcloud but is used by the undercloud and standalone to
allow access after installation.

Change-Id: Ie548f7216610e15af24c96f65a58cc8de603235c
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use libeatmydata during LXC cache prep

The LXC cache prep is timing out regularly so use eatmydata to minimise
pressure on the filesystem during package installation.

dpkg calls fsync for each file installed from each package which can
result in very poor performance on some filesystems. This patch gives
around a 4x improvement in "slow" gate runs, and 2x on esxi hdd storage.

Change-Id: I1cc33a7647445cd2302e6ea6b9d78005262ebfa3

commit_message:
Set project that owns managed resources

This change allow deployer to set project that will be owner of managed
resources like auto-created records and zones.
The owner is specified using project name and defaults to service
tenant.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/628979
Change-Id: I620be82d890aaa547decc59f81f55345f7177900
(cherry picked from commit 8facdee36c86b17789967224d73b192f7341c70b)

commit_message:
pylint: fix raising-non-exception error

django.http.HttpResponseNotFound is not an exception.
Django recommends to return it. @rest_utils.ajax can handle it.

Change-Id: I26f82da022a2c2725d62cc136c5da8eafc0ac26f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-16 12:11:08.000000000', 'message': 'Correct key name for PKI backend TTL

Switch max-lease-ttl -> max_lease_ttl inline with Vault API
docs to ensure that certs can be issued for more than 30 days.

Change-Id: I6a771090e320404c605d2170c7915c3c22a3ea2c
Closes-Bug: 1788945
'}, {'created': '2019-01-17 13:04:04.000000000', 'message': "Correct key name for PKI backend TTL

Switch max-lease-ttl -> max_lease_ttl inline with Vault API
docs to ensure that certs can be issued for more than 30 days.

Existing deployments with PKI enabled will be re-tuned to
set max_lease_ttl to 10 years, correcting any existing PKI
enablement.

Certificates must be re-issued to use the TTL as provided
during upload of the signed CSR for an Intermediate certificate.

For deploys using the internally signed Root CA, the root
CA must be re-generated using the 'disable-pki' and
'generate-root-ca' actions.

commit_message:
Correct key name for PKI backend TTL

Switch max-lease-ttl -> max_lease_ttl inline with Vault API
docs to ensure that certs can be issued for more than 30 days.

Existing deployments with PKI enabled will be re-tuned to
set max_lease_ttl to 10 years, correcting any existing PKI
enablement.

Certificates must be re-issued to use the TTL as provided
during upload of the signed CSR for an Intermediate certificate.

For deploys using the internally signed Root CA, the root
CA must be re-generated using the 'disable-pki' and
'generate-root-ca' actions.

Change-Id: I6a771090e320404c605d2170c7915c3c22a3ea2c
Closes-Bug: 1788945

commit_message:
Ensure sg rules associated to listeners are deleted

This patch ensure the sg rules associated to svc listeners are
deleted when the service spec/ports definition is modified, i.e.,
a listener port gets updated or deleted

Closes-Bug: 1812027
Change-Id: I6ee5d99172f6fdb185f32523a2c0fdfa92890dab

Skydive fails to compile unless WITH_OPENCONTRAIL=false. This

Change-Id: Ie6d165eb128fbfa1cece7f031b8a2416339641d5

commit_message:
Disable opencontrail build option for skydive

Skydive fails to compile unless WITH_OPENCONTRAIL=false. This
is a known issue on ubuntu hosts from the upstream project.

Change-Id: Ie6d165eb128fbfa1cece7f031b8a2416339641d5

> Ignore delete_on_termination property set by the user when volume_id is provided.

As discussed on irc before, if we change this from true to false for an update, it would try and replace the resource, which is not an acceptable solution.

Should we just abandon this and mark this feature as broken/deprecated as we don't seem to have a great solution and can't agree on the way forward?"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-01-21 14:57:38.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

We could not agree on the way forward.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-16 10:44:34.000000000', 'message': "Don't allow delete_on_termination=True when volume is specified

When a volume is specified for BDM terminating the instance in
ERROR state would delete the volume and result in undesired
behaviour in many circumstances like when we retry in CREATE
for server in ERROR state. Don't allow it when volume is specified.

Change-Id: I85439200113a719f2e1c7caea29ea8de57cb0a8d
Story: #2003415
Task: 24559
"}]
commit_message:
Don't allow delete_on_termination=True when volume is specified

When a volume is specified for BDM terminating the instance in
ERROR state would delete the volume and result in undesired
behaviour in many circumstances like when we retry in CREATE
for server in ERROR state. Don't allow it when volume is specified.

Change-Id: I85439200113a719f2e1c7caea29ea8de57cb0a8d
Story: #2003415
Task: 24559

When migrating stacks to convergence, if there are resources in
the database that are not in the current_template_id of the stack,

Story: #2004071

commit_message:
Delete db resources not in template

When migrating stacks to convergence, if there are resources in
the database that are not in the current_template_id of the stack,
they are possibly of no isue, so it would better to delete those
resources from db to avoid any future update issues.

Change-Id: Ica99cec6765d22d7ee2262e2d402b2e98cb5bd5e
Story: #2004071
Task: 27092

commit_message:
Set heatclient exceptions to verbose

By setting the verbose flag on the heatclient exception module, we allow
the traceback to be included in the error message, which in turns is
returned to tripleoclient for the user.

Change-Id: I45c54e6591690625c5160517bbbdfec2eb5e5e26
Closes-Bug: #1804268

commit_message:
Add pxe template per node

Allow to pass a pxe_template field in driver_info. If that is
present, it will search for the template file specified there,
instead of checking the per-arch/agent templates.

Change-Id: I436a61ad6a3e688bc6f833f5645c99be6d7e26e7
Story: #2004525
Task: #28264

[{'created': '2019-01-18 21:27:09.000000000', 'message': 'Update repositories of Centos base to get updated qemu

The default version of qemu that ships with CentOS, 1.5, does
not satisfy the minimum requirement for Nova. This path adds
the CentOS Enterprise qemu Repository that will install a
Nova compatible version of qemu.

Change-Id: Id307f244744857bd8b1b535e10559491d34c9775
'}]
owner_name: Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)
commit_message:
Update repositories of Centos base to get updated qemu

The default version of qemu that ships with CentOS, 1.5, does
not satisfy the minimum requirement for Nova. This path adds
the CentOS Enterprise qemu Repository that will install a
Nova compatible version of qemu.

Change-Id: Id307f244744857bd8b1b535e10559491d34c9775

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-18 12:09:33.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure that control plane hosts are also updated correctly

In queens the default for neutron_agents was set to deploy on metal.
so the exclusion of neutron_agents in the upgrade process for the
setup-hosts playbook end up excluding the whole control plane, which
is not good. One thing that happens for the Q->R upgrade is that the
apt proxy configuration is not removed, then all apt actions fail.

To ensure that we update the control plane as expected, we remove
the neutron_agents group from the exclusion.

Change-Id: Ic9453b042ac866abe55723dd16725f58e9453718
(cherry picked from commit 38b61e1027b3440f408c36f24fdcbe0037283c4d)
'}, {'created': '2019-01-07 09:04:53.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure that control plane hosts are also updated correctly

In queens the default for neutron_agents was set to deploy on metal.
so the exclusion of neutron_agents in the upgrade process for the
setup-hosts playbook end up excluding the whole control plane, which
is not good. One thing that happens for the Q->R upgrade is that the
apt proxy configuration is not removed, then all apt actions fail.

To ensure that we update the control plane as expected, we remove
the neutron_agents group from the exclusion.

Change-Id: Ic9453b042ac866abe55723dd16725f58e9453718
(cherry picked from commit 38b61e1027b3440f408c36f24fdcbe0037283c4d)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure that control plane hosts are also updated correctly

In queens the default for neutron_agents was set to deploy on metal.
so the exclusion of neutron_agents in the upgrade process for the
setup-hosts playbook end up excluding the whole control plane, which
is not good. One thing that happens for the Q->R upgrade is that the
apt proxy configuration is not removed, then all apt actions fail.

To ensure that we update the control plane as expected, we remove
the neutron_agents group from the exclusion.

Change-Id: Ic9453b042ac866abe55723dd16725f58e9453718
(cherry picked from commit 38b61e1027b3440f408c36f24fdcbe0037283c4d)

subject: devstack: Use 2.4.6 as elasticsearch version
messages:
[{'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-01-10 13:46:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-01-10 14:07:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Unfortunately Logstash is tied to 2.x until Python Kafka Client is upgraded. I haven't tried ES 6, but ES 5 is working in Kolla. Please report back if it works."}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-01-10 14:23:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2019-01-11 13:37:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Doug, what Logstash have to do with Python Kafka Client?
Logstash monasca log api output plugin is compatible with only v2 of Logstash and need updates to work with newer versions.

https://github.com/logstash-plugins/logstash-output-monasca_log_api'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-01-11 14:52:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

What I meant is that the Logstash Kafka plugin from Logstash 6 doesn't work with the messaging version that we are using in Kafka because it is too old, and that we can't upgrade the Kafka messaging version because the Python Kafka client needs upgrading first. Good point about the Monasca Logstash plugin though, I hadn't found that yet!"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2019-01-12 10:46:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2019-01-14 13:03:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add check if api_database.connection is set.

"nova-manage api_db sync" command is syncing both databases, placement and api.
In debian packaging we use "nova-manage api_db sync" in postinst scripts inside
nova-api and nova-placement-api packages to populate db. Now when nova-placement-api
is running postinst script, "nova-manage api_db sync" is throwing error that
[api_database]/connection is not configured, but placement api is populated
as expected, so that error is false positive. This patch is fixing this behaviour.

Change-Id: I5649fddc51b5651d3eb8b364e126002cbb9414ef

[{'created': '2019-01-18 16:37:26.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up the edge cases around states

Currently show_instance returns an Instance even if the requested node
is not actually an instance (e.g. just an available node). This change
corrects it. Make list_instances consistent with it.

Also make the states a proper enum to avoid consumers from using invalid
values (I did it several times when working on this patch).

Change-Id: If9aad0d7f4d10a7119d1f0bccc1cc32a918a72e3

commit_message:
Clean up the edge cases around states

Currently show_instance returns an Instance even if the requested node
is not actually an instance (e.g. just an available node). This change
corrects it. Make list_instances consistent with it.

Also make the states a proper enum to avoid consumers from using invalid
values (I did it several times when working on this patch).

Change-Id: If9aad0d7f4d10a7119d1f0bccc1cc32a918a72e3

subject: Checking connectivity from host to pod/service in the namespace
messages:
[{'account_id': 21302, 'date': '2018-12-24 09:23:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21302, 'date': '2018-12-24 09:24:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-01-02 08:06:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Just a couple of nits.
In addition, note this is not really testing host to pod connectivity in the way you may expect as this is not nested deployment and it is with devstack. Note this will be testing if the host can reach the svc/pod through the kubelet port that devstack is creating and the host is using to connect to the pods network. This port is set with the same SGs as the default pods, so it should be able to reach (and be reachable) by any namespace. That said, I think it is good to have the test anyway, just wanted to highlight that this may not test the connectivity in the way you expected'}, {'account_id': 21302, 'date': '2019-01-02 09:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Use default subnet mapping if subnet is not specified

This commit introduces default subnet mapping that
maps different driverTypes to default subnet related
to sertain driverType.
Mapping is used then subnet is not specified in
net-attach-def and continues previously merged patch
that closes bug 1810344

Change-Id: I558cd73f9a30a684d99bab9b2a251ae24e5a4397
Closes-Bug: 1811243

commit_message:
Ensure members are added to the pool upon svc updates

As kuryr is creating a new listener/pool for each port exposed
on the service, regardless of the target port being the same, this
patch ensures the members are added for all the pools, not only
in the first one created for a given target port

Closes-Bug: 1812047
Change-Id: I3aee1b546d1cd458a69fd61180f8fd4c7440d995

commit_message:
nova::quota fix correct conf group and rename params

The following commit [1] moved all the config options
regarding quota from the DEFAULT section to its own
[quota] section.

This patch corrects the nova::quota class so it sets
the config options in the correct group and also
deprecates the old naming of the parameters.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/de0eff47f2cfa271735bb754637f979659a2d91a

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614577/

(cherry picked from commit 9197f461d5ea904266f0c934aa2cca2d99dc8ff8)

subject: Allow to specify order of roles upgrade.
messages: [{'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2019-01-16 12:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2019-01-18 13:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2019-01-21 08:17:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-16 12:54:54.000000000', 'message': "Allow to specify order of roles upgrade.

We always start upgrade from Controllers role, that's a requirement.
Other roles are upgrade in the order in which they apper in
'overcloud' hostgroup from tripleo-ansible-inventory.

So far we cannot guarantee more than upgrading controllers first.
This change introduces new variable 'roles_upgrade_order'
(semi-colon separated list of roles),  which can specify desired order
of roles' upgrade.

WARNING: it's operator's responsibility to specify 'controller'
role as first item of a list.

Example of using 'roles_upgrade_order' variable:
  -e 'roles_upgrade_order=Controller,Database;Networker;Compute'
Here we start upgrade with Controller and Database roles,
 then Networker role and finishing with Compute role.

Default behavior is unchanged: we start by upgrading Controller role,
followed by a roles from tripleo-ansible-inventory.

Change-Id: I8807877990f569cf6eec76e162bc353e8a34ffe8
(cherry picked from commit 34b12e0dee83579001ff0a20c05e9d8131c199f9)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow to specify order of roles upgrade.

We always start upgrade from Controllers role, that's a requirement.
Other roles are upgrade in the order in which they apper in
'overcloud' hostgroup from tripleo-ansible-inventory.

So far we cannot guarantee more than upgrading controllers first.
This change introduces new variable 'roles_upgrade_order'
(semi-colon separated list of roles),  which can specify desired order
of roles' upgrade.

WARNING: it's operator's responsibility to specify 'controller'
role as first item of a list.

Example of using 'roles_upgrade_order' variable:
  -e 'roles_upgrade_order=Controller,Database;Networker;Compute'
Here we start upgrade with Controller and Database roles,
 then Networker role and finishing with Compute role.

Default behavior is unchanged: we start by upgrading Controller role,
followed by a roles from tripleo-ansible-inventory.

Change-Id: I8807877990f569cf6eec76e162bc353e8a34ffe8
(cherry picked from commit 34b12e0dee83579001ff0a20c05e9d8131c199f9)

commit_message:
Retire puppet-stackalytics (part 1)

The repo openstack-infra/puppet-stackalytics has been created with the
intent to host stackalytics by the OpenStack Infra team - and this did not
happen. We will therefore retire the repository.

Announcement was sent:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-January/001875.html

Change-Id: Ie65393704db84382cd5d9594bb97dac8285b7b94

commit_message:
Set your-readthedocs-job-requires-attention host localhost

Now that this job runs on on the executor, we need to force localhost,
since it is not part of all.

Change-Id: Ia901ee929e0123021bdc97e0135fdb4f309c7178
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

So I thing a better way is to add a new option directly controls the ceiling.'}, {'account_id': 29446, 'date': '2018-12-12 08:56:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-07 06:28:52.000000000', 'message': "Add a getter and modify the related codes

A getter of the newly added option rpc_max_timeout is added. The codes
related to this adding is on oslo_messaging.rpc.py.

_max_timeout and its setters are useless temporarily because users can
now directly change the rpc_max_timeout in neutron.conf. However,
there're not deleted as we should not prevent the developer to override
this parameter.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/621059/1
Change-Id: I45d2e5c063d2dd43cb8aec1d46faa3ee8ea4825f
Related-Bug: #1805769
Story: 2004456
Task: 28171
"}, {'created': '2018-12-07 08:07:47.000000000', 'message': "Add a getter and modify the related codes

A getter of the newly added option rpc_max_timeout is added. The codes
related to this adding is on oslo_messaging.rpc.py.

_max_timeout and its setters are useless temporarily because users can
now directly change the rpc_max_timeout in neutron.conf. However,
there're not deleted as we should not prevent the developer to override
this parameter.

Change-Id: I45d2e5c063d2dd43cb8aec1d46faa3ee8ea4825f
Related-Bug: #1805769
Story: 2004456
Task: 28171
"}, {'created': '2018-12-12 02:54:40.000000000', 'message': "Add a new configuration parameter rpc_max_timeout

A new parameter rpc_max_timeout is added and registered into neutron.conf.

The rpc_max_timeout plays a role of the ceiling of timeout seconds when
waiting for the response of a remote rpc server.

During an RPC call, the waiting time starts from the existing parameter
rpc_response_timeout(default 60s) and doubled each time until it reaches
the ceiling() which is currently set as 10 times rpc_response_timeout.
It seems to be less flexible since user cannot directly change the
ceiling value unless he/she changes the rpc_response_timeout. By adding
rpc_max_timeout, user can now modify it without changing the any other
parameters.

In class _BackingOffContextWrapper, _max_timeout and its setters are
useless temporarily because users can now directly change the rpc_max_
timeout in neutron.conf. However, there're not deleted as we should not
prevent the developer to override this parameter.

Change-Id: I45d2e5c063d2dd43cb8aec1d46faa3ee8ea4825f
Related-Bug: #1805769
Story: 2004456
Task: 28171
"}, {'created': '2018-12-20 05:25:56.000000000', 'message': "Add a new configuration parameter rpc_max_timeout

A new parameter rpc_max_timeout is added and registered into
neutron.conf. (related codes in neutron)

The rpc_max_timeout plays a role of the ceiling of timeout seconds when
waiting for the response of a remote rpc server.

During an RPC call, the waiting time starts from the existing parameter
rpc_response_timeout(default 60s) and doubled each time until it reaches
the ceiling which is currently set as 10 times rpc_response_timeout.
It seems to be less flexible since user cannot directly change the
ceiling value unless he/she changes the rpc_response_timeout. By adding
rpc_max_timeout, user can now modify it without changing the any other
parameters.

In class _BackingOffContextWrapper, _max_timeout and its setters are
useless temporarily because users can now directly change the rpc_max_
timeout in neutron.conf. However, there're not deleted as we should not
prevent the developer to override this parameter.

Co-Authored-By: Allain Legacy<Allain.legacy@windriver.com>

Change-Id: I45d2e5c063d2dd43cb8aec1d46faa3ee8ea4825f
Related-Bug: #1805769
Story: 2004456
Task: 28171

It seems to be less flexible since user cannot directly change the

In class _BackingOffContextWrapper, _max_timeout and its setters are

"}, {'created': '2018-12-21 01:38:26.000000000', 'message': "Add a new configuration parameter rpc_max_timeout

A new parameter rpc_max_timeout is added and registered into
neutron.conf. (related codes in neutron)

The rpc_max_timeout plays a role of the ceiling of timeout
seconds when waiting for the response of a remote rpc server.

During an RPC call, the waiting time starts from the existing parameter
rpc_response_timeout(default 60s) and doubled each time until it reaches
the ceiling which is currently set as 10 times rpc_response_timeout.
It seems to be less flexible since user cannot directly change the
ceiling value unless he/she changes the rpc_response_timeout.

commit_message:
Add a new configuration parameter rpc_response_max_timeout

A new parameter rpc_response_max_timeout is added and registered into
neutron.conf. (related codes in neutron)

The rpc_response_max_timeout plays a role of the ceiling of timeout
seconds when waiting for the response of a remote rpc server.

During an RPC call, the waiting time starts from the existing parameter
rpc_response_timeout(default 60s) and doubled each time until it reaches
the ceiling which is currently set as 10 times rpc_response_timeout.
It seems to be less flexible since user cannot directly change the
ceiling value unless he/she changes the rpc_response_timeout.

By adding rpc_response_max_timeout, user can now modify it without
changing any other parameters.

In class _BackingOffContextWrapper, _max_timeout and its setters are
useless temporarily because users can now directly change the rpc_max_
timeout in neutron.conf. However, there're not deleted as we should not
prevent the developer to override this parameter.

Co-Authored-By: Allain Legacy<Allain.legacy@windriver.com>

Change-Id: I45d2e5c063d2dd43cb8aec1d46faa3ee8ea4825f
Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626109
Related-Bug: #1805769
Story: 2004456
Task: 28171

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > As far as I'm concerned, it is reasonable that the scheduler keeps
 > quiet for the periodic time to wait for all volumes services ready.
 > I am -1 for the patch.

Hi, thanks for your review. In fact, cinder-scheduler does not need to sleep for the periodic time, because cinder-volume will return the message immediately after receiving the request, instead of waiting for the periodic time before sending.
Especially when this time is long, such as an hour, cinder-volume is ready, but cinder-scheduler still needs to sleep for an hour to start, which happens in my production environment and is unacceptable to me."}, {'account_id': 24250, 'date': '2018-11-28 08:47:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Fix the problem of the scheduler status

During the startup process of cinder-scheduler, the time corresponding
to the periodic_interval parameter will be sleeped. If the value of
this parameter is large, such as one hour, then during this period the
cinder-scheduler is always down and the volume cannot be created.

This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: I932a725c1665add590f09fa8d26e84b79b06e159
Closes-bug: #1802249

[{'created': '2018-12-10 20:30:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix permissions with NFS-backed snapshots and backups

Fix snapshot issues that occur if cinder does not have regular (non-root)
write permission on an NFS share. This is done by following the volume
driver's model of creating files as root, followed by calling
_set_rw_permissions().

Fix backup issues that occur if cinder's group ID changes, which can
happen when migrating from bare metal to a containerized service. If the
share's group ownership and permission needs to be modified, then do it
recursively so that previously made backups remain accessible.

Closes-Bug: #1807760
Change-Id: I6c20c4825af0a365b6a20fb633c810c2f2fe48b0
"}, {'created': '2018-12-11 13:14:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix permissions with NFS-backed snapshots and backups

Fix snapshot issues that occur if cinder does not have regular (non-root)
write permission on an NFS share. This is done by following the volume
driver's model of creating files as root, followed by calling
_set_rw_permissions().

Fix backup issues that occur if cinder's group ID changes, which can
happen when migrating from bare metal to a containerized service. If the
share's group ownership and permission needs to be modified, then do it
recursively so that previously made backups remain accessible.

Closes-Bug: #1807760
Change-Id: I6c20c4825af0a365b6a20fb633c810c2f2fe48b0
"}]
commit_message:
Fix permissions with NFS-backed snapshots and backups

Fix snapshot issues that occur if cinder does not have regular (non-root)
write permission on an NFS share. This is done by following the volume
driver's model of creating files as root, followed by calling
_set_rw_permissions().

Fix backup issues that occur if cinder's group ID changes, which can
happen when migrating from bare metal to a containerized service. If the
share's group ownership and permission needs to be modified, then do it
recursively so that previously made backups remain accessible.

Closes-Bug: #1807760
Change-Id: I6c20c4825af0a365b6a20fb633c810c2f2fe48b0

commit_message:
Migrating oslo.config to use stestr

os-testr has moved over to use stestr instead of testr. While this
is usually compaible with existing settings, there is a warning
that is emitted when .stestr.conf is not present. It is usually
able to fall back to parsing the .testr.conf file, but to be more
correct and to prevent future problems we should update the config.

Change-Id: I929f75d069f20b8cfa8af4e0712883e91a54dc4f

commit_message:
Add test case: extend non-exist volume

This patch add test case: volume cannot be extended when the volume
does not exist. For example: when we execute extend CLI, mistype
volume-id accidentally, program will detect that the volume does
not exist and command line will report "ERROR: No volume with a
name or ID of ...".

Change-Id: Iabd1cf8f149a1a63dc8b43744fde52419ca6008e

commit_message:
[Horizon] Hide OS and Apache version in error messages

This PS allows to customize (and disable) information about OS and
Apache version displayed on pages with error messages.

Change-Id: Ic4d19bcc90dadf5cf26faa5c8fb39de00a6f3212

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-05 16:59:09.000000000', 'message': 'Add Chassis<->ComputerSystem/Manager linkage

Redfish data model rests on three interlinked
entities - ComputerSystem(s), Manager(s) and Chassis. As of this
moment, sushy does not support traversal via Chassis despite the
availability of such linkage in the JSON documents sushy feeds on.

This change establishes Chassis<->ComputerSystem/Managers links.

Change-Id: If26f95b3ef6d70419b3c37b3e9eabe41be258c8d
Story: 2004512

commit_message:
Add Chassis<->ComputerSystem/Manager linkage

Redfish data model rests on three interlinked
entities - ComputerSystem(s), Manager(s) and Chassis. As of this
moment, sushy does not support traversal via Chassis despite the
availability of such linkage in the JSON documents sushy feeds on.

This change establishes Chassis<->ComputerSystem/Managers links.

Change-Id: If26f95b3ef6d70419b3c37b3e9eabe41be258c8d
Story: 2004512
Task: 28308

commit_message:
Change Apache Kafka download site

Currently, monasca-analytics's devstack-plugin downloads
Apache Kafka from "ftp.riken.jp".
It is better to use "archive.apache.org" instead of "ftp.riken.jp".
That archive site is also used in other projects(e.g. monasca-api).

Change-Id: I9be43c052ca46ffec5ed6a1ffe3278b9e0325efb

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/624333/1 : SUCCESS in 1h 59m 40s'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-12-11 11:49:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

It is not duplicated, hypervisor-marker is used from microversion 2.33 to 2.52, hypervisor-marker-uuid is used from 2.53 on'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-12-12 00:32:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> It is not duplicated, hypervisor-marker is used from microversion
 > 2.33 to 2.52, hypervisor-marker-uuid is used from 2.53 on

Yeah, on the surface it doesn't repeat, but the code verifies the ``hypervisor-marker-uuid`` of "type:string".'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-12-12 01:24:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > It is not duplicated, hypervisor-marker is used from microversion
 > > 2.33 to 2.52, hypervisor-marker-uuid is used from 2.53 on
 > 
 > Yeah, on the surface it doesn't repeat, but the code verifies the
 > ``hypervisor-marker-uuid`` of "type:string".

It is not about the type, they are all string type. in 2.53, we added uuid field because of cells, so user should use uuid as marker, but before 2.53(2.33 to 2.52) user should use ID, because old releases would not have UUID field.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-12-20 23:08:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

It should be left as it is.
Up to microversion 2.52, the marker is non-negatice integer.
Starting from microversion 2.53, it is a UUID string.
It should be explained to users.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-01-21 00:56:54.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Remove the unused parameter from os-hypervisors

There are two ``marker`` parameters in the request parameter of [1], but
only of type "type:string" is used in the interface, you can find in [2].

[1]https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=list-hypervisors-details-detail#list-hypervisors-details
[2]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/hypervisors.py#L17-L33

Change-Id: Ief3d196a006e44a084e73f9906d6d0100e682704

commit_message:
Fix calico track branch in rocky

Networking-calico in rocky should still point to master, as it was done before.
There is indeed no branching on this project, and we've always updated it (instead
of freezing it).

Change-Id: I094f3f636bb2826da63a36c84a293754efe901ed

messages: [{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-01-17 22:07:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-01-18 09:39:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1\n\nDuplicate of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/631286/, sorry for breaking you!'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-01-20 22:30:50.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-17 22:07:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix upper-constraints.txt fallback copying

This fixes a regression introduced via
I8d6f8c99e1ab5f26e3537630d0f6086e02a2b1ec and noticed in the
diskimage-builder ironic-python-agent tests.  Previously the
copy_new_requirements_uc() function would return the value of the
copy() function, which would be "1" if there was nothing to copy.

Introduce an else clause so that if the files aren't on disk, we take
the fallback path of downloading it.

Change-Id: I547e6845b18c71cb9b70ad6e6b17698bdbe4138c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix upper-constraints.txt fallback copying

This fixes a regression introduced via
I8d6f8c99e1ab5f26e3537630d0f6086e02a2b1ec and noticed in the
diskimage-builder ironic-python-agent tests.  Previously the
copy_new_requirements_uc() function would return the value of the
copy() function, which would be "1" if there was nothing to copy.

Introduce an else clause so that if the files aren't on disk, we take
the fallback path of downloading it.

Change-Id: I547e6845b18c71cb9b70ad6e6b17698bdbe4138c

commit_message:
remove external_network_bridge option

The external_network_bridge option is deprecated/legacy and being
removed from neutron [1].
This patch removes the neutron_external_network_bridge neutron option.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567369/

Change-Id: Ibc6bfef0986a54d5e7b9502d1aaa0b2a08077995

commit_message:
use ansible_hostname to construct canonical_hostname in /etc/hosts

inventory_hostname is ansible alias of the host. It may be
equal to hostname in most cases, but also can be short alias for
convenience.
ansible_hostname is discovered hostname, i.e. real hostname.
It make more sense to use real hostname to construct fqdn
and use inventory_hostname as an alias.

Change-Id: If980f67da27035aa81b554ef59dedaf5a34357f4
(cherry picked from commit 5b9cf44498941d691ab4f776324b0285656cca6d)

commit_message:
Increase LXC container default shutdown delay

Increase container shutdown delay before force-killing to avoid db
corruption after controller reboots
Parameterize SHUTDOWNDELAY envvar as lxc_container_shutdown_delay
with default value 60 seconds
Rename lxc.default.j2 template to lxc-net.default.j2 to align with
destination config file name lxc-net
Add new lxc.default.j2 template to use the lxc_container_shutdown_delay
variable and allow user-defined value

Related-Bug: 1806696

Change-Id: I1d3b7990e462140fdb402883f8d25422eafca66b

[{'created': '2019-01-17 21:23:12.000000000', 'message': 'Do not install linux-image-extra by default

In Ubuntu 14.04, the kernel shipped was lightweight, and some
extra features like using vhost_net, required the package
linux-image-extra.

In Ubuntu 16.04 and above, this is not the case anymore,
as many kernel packages ship with extra features.

vhost_net is generally shipped with the kernel package nowadays
and was the only one documented for the addition of the

Closes-Bug: 1783342
(cherry picked from commit 8c46d189889987148d6f6906ef2ea66c17f69bed)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not install linux-image-extra by default

In Ubuntu 14.04, the kernel shipped was lightweight, and some
extra features like using vhost_net, required the package
linux-image-extra.

In Ubuntu 16.04 and above, this is not the case anymore,
as many kernel packages ship with extra features.

vhost_net is generally shipped with the kernel package nowadays
and was the only one documented for the addition of the
linux-image-extra into our roles.

Change-Id: I579484ccefe0f29c40f8fed4b2d1b73aaeb917b1
Closes-Bug: 1783342
(cherry picked from commit 8c46d189889987148d6f6906ef2ea66c17f69bed)

The failure is in cinder.tests.unit.db.test_migrations.TestMysqlMigrations: "sqlalchemy.exc.ResourceClosedError: This result object does not return rows. It has been closed automatically"

This looks just like https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1739517 which was filed for Nova in December 2017 and then closed because it didn't seem to be happening any more.  The logstash query on that bug shows that it's happened 12 times over the past week, which isn't a lot (and it's all cinder or manila).  Also, I don't think today's logs have been pulled into logstash yet, so there may be some more.

It's weird that it hit the lower-constraints job on the last run but not either of the py3 jobs.  Makes me think it could be that our l-c need some adjusting?

Off the top of my head, these would be relevant to db migrations.  Here's what the tox logs say we're using:

l-c:
alembic==0.9.8
oslo.db==4.27.0
SQLAlchemy==1.0.10
sqlalchemy-migrate==0.11.0

py35, py36
alembic==1.0.5
oslo.db==4.43.0
SQLAlchemy==1.2.16
sqlalchemy-migrate==0.11.0

I'm going to try a recheck.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-01-11 23:40:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Pass image_id to ImageDownloadFailed

When an ImageDownloadFailed exception is created in the
GlanceImageService, it's being passed the context whereas what
makes sense for the error message is the image_id.  This patch
makes the change and adds a unit test for a previous fix for
Bug #1798147 (which was the real point of this patch).

Change-Id: I6d8dedfd056add3414f8f4bf7f7279eae4763286
Closes-bug: #1811184

commit_message:
Ensure skydive binary is built as static

The binary is only portable between operating systems if it is
statically linked. This is how the ready made skydive binaries
from github are built.

Change-Id: I8f7b56cbadf70502640b83f87c7cd0132f96730d

commit_message:
Update hacking version to latest

Use latest release 1.1.0 and compatible changes w.r.t pep8

Change-Id: I7d0661b59684271d08e240299a2a23a6d16da95d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-05 04:45:02.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup files and templates using smart sources

The files and templates we carry are almost always in a state of
maintenance. The upstream services are maintaining these files and
there's really no reason we need to carry duplicate copies of them. This
change removes all of the files we expect to get from the upstream
service. while the focus of this change is to remove configuration file
maintenance burdens it also allows the role to execute faster.

  * Source installs have the configuration files within the venv at
    "<<VENV_PATH>>/etc/<<SERVICE_NAME>>". The role will now link the
    default configuration path to this directory. When the service is
    upgraded the link will move to the new venv path.
  * Distro installs package all of the required configuration files.

To maintain our current capabilities to override configuration the
role will fetch files from the disk whenever an override is provided and
then push the fetched file back to the target using `config_template`.

Change-Id: Ib3447cd5b0bcada4cdf82d9e4a9fe5160299f9c3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-08-05 04:52:45.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup files and templates using smart sources

service. while the focus of this change is to remove configuration file
maintenance burdens it also allows the role to execute faster.

  * Source installs have the configuration files within the venv at
    "<<VENV_PATH>>/etc/<<SERVICE_NAME>>". The role will now link the
    default configuration path to this directory. When the service is
    upgraded the link will move to the new venv path.
  * Distro installs package all of the required configuration files.

To maintain our current capabilities to override configuration the
role will fetch files from the disk whenever an override is provided and
then push the fetched file back to the target using `config_template`.

Change-Id: Ib3447cd5b0bcada4cdf82d9e4a9fe5160299f9c3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup files and templates using smart sources

The files and templates we carry are almost always in a state of
maintenance. The upstream services are maintaining these files and
there's really no reason we need to carry duplicate copies of them. This
change removes all of the files we expect to get from the upstream
service. while the focus of this change is to remove configuration file
maintenance burdens it also allows the role to execute faster.

  * Source installs have the configuration files within the venv at
    "<<VENV_PATH>>/etc/<<SERVICE_NAME>>". The role will now link the
    default configuration path to this directory. When the service is
    upgraded the link will move to the new venv path.
  * Distro installs package all of the required configuration files.

To maintain our current capabilities to override configuration the
role will fetch files from the disk whenever an override is provided and
then push the fetched file back to the target using `config_template`.

Change-Id: Ib3447cd5b0bcada4cdf82d9e4a9fe5160299f9c3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Update messaging notification configuration

This patch add the conditional inclusion of the notification
section of the service configuration. This ensures that oslo.messaging
notifications use the correct transport for deployments that have
separate rpc and notify messaging backends. For example, if the
transport_url is not provided in the notification section of the
service configuration, the transport_url specified in the default
section will be used instead.

This patch conditionally selects the notifier driver. The noop
driver will be selected when notification publishing is disabled.
The messagingv2 driver is selected when notification publishing is
enabled.

Change-Id: Ie5cc5499980f986f1a7e530adf42f4dcc43fbaca
Closes-Bug: #1794320

commit_message:
Fix verify-config KeyError

When a user runs verify-config while custom, third
party plugins are available in the system, it fails
with KeyError.
The patch fixes that by informing a user about the
plugins and suggesting their setup.

Related-Bug: #1812385
Change-Id: I8019a82717d9463bdc1a6e5025758e1f917358bb

Change-Id: I09c4a51410dffaec21ab0bb3db85df8c776c92e5
"}]
commit_message:
Don't update existing port if no change

This allows external service pre-create a neutron port with
'binding:host_id' populated before passing the port to kuryr.
This is important because setting 'binding:host_id' is slow.
This blocks the docker daemon for serving other requests,
which blocks the whole system.
We want to have this field pre-populated so that the docker
daemon won't be blocked by this API call.

This commit also allows the 'device_owner' field to be
customized if users choose to pre-populate the 'binding:host_id'
field. In addition, this commit skips the API call to update the
neutron port if the 'binding:host_id' is pre-populated
and 'admin_state_up' and 'mac_address' fields are unchanged.

Closes-Bug: #1809306
Change-Id: I09c4a51410dffaec21ab0bb3db85df8c776c92e5

use stable branch for jobs - stable/1.0
